attributes.magic: ELF 64-bit LSB executable, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked, interpreter /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2, for GNU/Linux 2.6.4, BuildID[sha1]=8610854b09164d7f1b58dcb56eb99a87bcb75ae4, stripped

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects unknown Linux implants (uploads from KR and MO)
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects BPFDoor implants used by Chinese actor Red Menshen
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detect the BPFDoor backdoor used by the Chinese TA Red Menshen
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Sekoia.io

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: This ELF binary is a sophisticated Linux backdoor and rootkit-like agent designed for persistence and covert remote access. Key malicious behaviors include: 1. Process Masquerading: It dynamically renames its process to mimic legitimate system daemons such as '/sbin/udevd', '/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-journald', and 'postfix/master' to evade detection. 2. Anti-Forensics: It clears environment variables, sets 'HISTFILE=/dev/null' to prevent command logging, and uses '/dev/shm' (shared memory) for temporary execution and self-deletion. 3. Network Backdoor: It utilizes raw sockets for packet sniffing to identify trigger packets, provides an interactive remote shell via '/bin/bash' redirected through PTYs ('/dev/ptmx'), and implements custom stream encryption (RC4-like) for C2 communication. 4. Firewall Manipulation: It executes 'iptables' commands to create NAT redirects and permit unauthorized ingress traffic. IOCs include the PID file '/var/run/kdevrund.pid', the use of '/dev/shm' for binary staging, and specific iptables manipulation strings.
